intro: Hedyotis tenelliflora var. longipes, commonly known as the slender leaf bladdernut, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of tiny white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
